title: Acer said it halted business in Russia but kept selling monitors & reportedly PCs
description: Reuters says Acer used Swiss subsidiary to send Russia "at least" 744 shipments.

title: Researchers discover that ChatGPT prefers repeating 25 jokes over and over
description: When tested, "Over 90% of 1,008 generated jokes were the same 25 jokes."

title: Musk on path to turn Twitter into the next MySpace or Yahoo, co-founder suggests
description: Ev Williams: Generally, "the new thing does not come from the old thing."

title: Billion-year-old grease hints at long history of complex cells
description: Our ancestors once thrived on cholesterols that are now just reaction intermediates.

title: Judge denies Amazon’s, Apple’s motions to dismiss class action price-fixing suit
description: Which markets are hurt by companies' agreement is "reserved for a jury."

title: Google’s Bard AI can now write and execute code to answer a question
description: Google says having an LLM write code is akin to humans doing long division.

title: Leaked Tesla report shows Cybertruck had basic design flaws
description: “Alpha” version had problems with braking, handling, noise, and leaks.

title: Blue Microphones branding is going away after 28 years
description: The Blue name was a hat-tip to the co-founder's Latvian roots.

title: One man’s nearly 40-year, 8-bit quest to finish his teenage Commodore 64 RPG
description: Disks and tapes are fallible, so it's back to assembly code and pencil notes.

title: Nvidia’s AI software tricked into leaking data
description: Researchers manipulate feature in ways that could reveal sensitive information.

title: OpenAI faces defamation suit after ChatGPT completely fabricated another lawsuit
description: ChatGPT continues causing trouble by making up lawsuits.

title: Beer byproducts were popular canvas primers for Danish Golden Age artists
description: "In 19th century Denmark, beer brewing was a paramount part of the culture and economy."

title: Call of Duty removes “NickMercs” skin following FaZe Clan star’s LGBTQ tweet
description: Move highlights reputational risk of in-game promos linked to real-world players.

title: I just bought the only physical encyclopedia still in print, and I regret nothing
description: The still-updated World Book Encyclopedia is my antidote to the information apocalypse.

title: Dealmaster: Savings on practical Father’s Day tech gift ideas
description: Our curated Father's Day list of the favorite toys and tech dads will love.

title: A telescope happened to be pointing at the brightest supernova yet observed
description: The BOAT—brightest of all time—reveals the mechanics of gamma-ray bursts.
